Blood and Confusion

A dimly lit room; Raskolnikov is pale and anxious.  
His mind races with dread.  
Raskolnikov: “Blood? What blood?”  
Nastasya: “Nobody has been beating the landlady.”  
Raskolnikov: “I heard it myself… I was sitting up.”  

---  

Same room; Nastasya stands firm, watching him.  
She speaks with conviction.  
Nastasya: “That’s the blood crying in your ears.”  
Nastasya: “Will you eat something?”  
Raskolnikov: “Give me something to drink… Nastasya.”  

---  

Nastasya returns with a jug of water.  
Raskolnikov gulps, spilling some on himself.  
Raskolnikov: “…”  
(He drifts into forgetfulness.)

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov, in a feverish state, struggles with hallucinations and confusion about a supposed incident involving blood and the landlady.
